This attribute will be deleted before providing the data to the public.  Default:  UNK  (Logical Attribute: None.)</attrdef><attrdefs>BLM Administrative Units (Boundaries) Implementation Guidelines, Ver.1.2, June 6, 2011</attrdefs><attrdomv><udom>A mixture of characters and numbers based on a person's name.</udom></attrdomv></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">MODIFY_DAT</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">MODIFY_DAT</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">Date</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">8</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">ADMIN_ST</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">ADMIN_ST</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">2</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef>Administrative State Code:  Two letter, upper case abbreviation for the administrative state office.  The current list of values is:  AK, AZ, CA, CO, ES, ID, MT, NM, NV, OR, UT and WY.  In the FBMS Organization Codes, use the second 2 characters (after the LL).  (e.g. LLAK039000).    Attribute Domain Assignment:  DOM_ADMIN_ST   (Logical Attribute: State Alphabetic Code.  An alphabetic abbreviation that represents each of the 50 states of the United States, the District of Columbia, the outlying areas of the United States, and associated areas.  FIPS PUB 5-2.)  An administrative unit that identifies the state or geographic area which has administrative jurisdiction over lands, and cases.  The land for a case may not be physically located in the associated administrative state.  Only those states that are BLM administrative states are in the domain for this entity. Example: Montana is the Administrative State for public lands in the geographic States of Montana, South and North Dakota.</attrdef><attrdefs>BLM Administrative Units (Boundaries) Implementation Guidelines, Ver.1.2, June 6, 2011</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">PT_SRC_TYP</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">PT_SRC_TYP</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth STATES</country></cntAddress><cntPhone><voiceNum tddtty="">208-373-3998</voiceNum><voiceNum tddtty="">208-373-4000</voiceNum></cntPhone><cntHours>7:45 A.M. - 4:15 P.M., Mountain Time, Monday - Friday</cntHours></rpCntInfo></citRespParty></idCitation><idAbs><DIV STYLE="text-align:Left;"><DIV><DIV><P><SPAN>Point features used to show the locations of BLM offices. Each physical location is represented with one point, where possible. One office location may administer more than one administrative unit. Likewise, more than one office may be co-located at one location. The feature class includes attributes to store feature level metadata information. Several attributes document the origin and characteristics of the points.</SPAN></P><P><SPAN>The Bureau of Land Management uses a multiple tier organization to manage the land. With some exceptions, the land that the BLM manages is served by field offices. Most of these field offices are managed by district offices, which in turn are managed by State Offices.</SPAN></P><P><SPAN /></P></DIV></DIV></DIV></idAbs><idPurp>The intended use of all data in the BLM's GIS library is to support diverse activities including planning, management, maintenance, research, and interpretation.</idPurp><idStatus><ProgCd value="001" /></idStatus><idPoC><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office, Engineering and Geographic Sciences</rpOrgName><rpPosName>Geographic Sciences Supervisor</rpPosName><rpCntInfo><cntPhone><voiceNum tddtty="">208-373-3998</voiceNum><faxNum>208-373-3949</faxNum><voiceNum tddtty="">208-373-4000</voiceNum></cntPhone><cntAddress STATES</country></cntAddress><cntHours>7:45 A.M. - 4:15 P.M., Mountain Time, Monday - Friday</cntHours><cntInstr>Contact the Supervisor of the Geographic Sciences Section for any information regarding In no event shall the BLM have any liability whatsoever for payment of any consequential, incidental, indirect, special, or tort damages of any kind, including, but not limited to, any loss of profits arising out of the use or reliance on the geographic data or arising out of the delivery, installation, operation, or support by BLM.</useLimit></LegConsts><Consts><useLimit><DIV STYLE="text-align:Left;"><DIV><DIV><P><SPAN>These data are provided by the Bureau of Land Management (BLM) \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdas is\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd and might contain errors or omissions. The User assumes the entire risk associated with its use of these data and bears all responsibility in determining whether these data are fit for the User\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds intended use. The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the sources from which they were derived, and both scale and accuracy may vary across the data set. These data might not have the accuracy, resolution, completeness, timeliness, or other characteristics appropriate for applications that potential users of the data may contemplate. The User is encouraged to carefully consider the content of the metadata file associated with these data. These data are neither legal documents nor land surveys, and must not be used as such. Official records may be referenced at most BLM offices. Please report any errors in the data to the BLM office from which it was obtained. The BLM should be cited as the data source in any products derived from these data. Any Users wishing to modify the data should describe the types of modifications they have performed. The User should not misrepresent the data, nor imply that changes made were approved or endorsed by BLM. This data may be updated by the BLM without notification.</SPAN></P><P><SPAN /></P></DIV></DIV></DIV></useLimit></Consts></resConst><dataLang><languageCode value="eng" /><countryCode value="USA" Sync="TRUE" /></dataLang><dataExt><exDesc>publication date</exDesc><tempEle><TempExtent><exTemp><TM_Instant><tmPosition>2010-10-01T00:00:00</tmPosition></TM_Instant></exTemp></TempExtent></tempEle><geoEle /></dataExt><envirDesc Sync="TRUE">Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.1.3143</envirDesc><spatRpType><SpatRepTypCd value="001" Sync="TRUE" /></spatRpType><dataExt><geoEle><GeoBndBox esriExtentType="search"><exTypeCode Sync="TRUE">1</exTypeCode><westBL Sync="TRUE">-117.021624</westBL><eastBL Sync="TRUE">-111.851499</eastBL><northBL Sync="TRUE">47.748807</northBL><southBL Sync="TRUE">42.470415</southBL></GeoBndBox></geoEle></dataExt><themeKeys><thesaLang><languageCode value="eng" /></thesaLang><thesaName><resTitle>A-Z Index of U. Government Departments and Agencies</resTitle><presForm><fgdcGeoform>document</fgdcGeoform><PresFormCd value="001" /></presForm><date><reviseDate>2012-10-17T00:00:00</reviseDate></date><citOnlineRes><linkage>http://www.usa.gov/directory/federal/index.shtml</linkage><orFunct><OnFunctCd value="002" /></orFunct></citOnlineRes></thesaName><keyword>Bureau of Land Management</keyword><keyword>BLM</keyword><keyword>Department of the Interior</keyword><keyword>DOI</keyword></themeKeys><dataChar><CharSetCd value="004" /></dataChar><suppInfo>This is a National Operations Center (NOC) national dataset. </suppInfo><dataScale><equScale><rfDenom>24000</rfDenom></equScale></dataScale><tpCat><TopicCatCd value="013" /></tpCat></dataIdInfo><dqInfo><dqScope><scpLvl><ScopeCd value="005" /></scpLvl></dqScope><report type="DQDomConsis" dimension="horizontal"><measDesc>BLM has a data standard for administrative units (points) that describes domains for the ADMIN_ST, ADM_UNIT_CD, BLM_ORG_TYPE and MNGD_UNIT_CD attributes.</measDesc><evalMethDesc>Domains were created for the BLM administrative units points feature class: DOM_ADMIN_ST, DOM_ADM_UNIT_CD,  and DOM_BLM_ORG_TYPE.  At data entery, the user is forced to select only those values in the domain.  The data was also visually inspected for errors.</evalMethDesc><measResult><ConResult><conExpl>All values matched the domain values.</conExpl><conPass>1</conPass></ConResult></measResult><evalProc><resTitle>BLM Instruction Memorandum No. 2011-063, Change 1</resTitle><resAltTitle>Revised Bureau of Land Management (BLM) Administrative Units (Boundaries) Data Standards and Database Submission Requirements</resAltTitle><date><pubDate>2011-11-16T00:00:00</pubDate></date><resEd>Change 1</resEd><resEdDate>20111116</resEdDate><citRespParty><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior, Bureau of Land Management (BLM)</rpOrgName><role><RoleCd value="006" /></role><rpCntInfo><cntAddress addressType="both"><city>Washington</city><adminArea>District of Columbia</adminArea><postCode>20240</postCode><country>UNITED STATES</country></cntAddress><cntOnlineRes><linkage>http://www.blm.gov</linkage><orFunct><OnFunctCd value="001" /></orFunct></cntOnlineRes></rpCntInfo></citRespParty></evalProc></report><report type="DQCompOm" dimension="horizontal"><measDesc>All Idaho State, District and Field Offices and are accounted for.  These points represent those offices at the field office level and above.  Other types of offices such as duty stations and temp stations are not included in this implementation.</measDesc></report><report type="DQAbsExtPosAcc" dimension="horizontal"><measDesc>This data was gathered using the NRCS 2009 NAIP imagery. The office buildings are correctly identified and any error in their location would be attributed to the NAIP imagery.</measDesc></report><dataLineage><dataSource type=""><srcDesc>This document and its attachments provide the data standards for developing and maintaining the BLM Administrative Units (boundaries).  Attachment 1 of this IM entitled, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdBLM Administrative Units (boundaries) Data Standard Report (25 pp)\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd is intended to be a logical, vendor neutral, description of the data standard. Attachment 2, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdBLM Administrative Units (boundaries) Implementation Guidelines (36 pp)\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd describes implementation of these standards using the GIS vendor\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds software. The three-page document entitled, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdBLM Administrative Units (boundaries) Domains\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (Attachment 3) lists the domain or \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdvalid values\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd for different attributes contained within the data standard.  The Data Model Diagram in Attachment 4 shows the Entity Relationship Diagram of the data standard information in yellow and the related data elements in green. This diagram represents the information documented in the Data Standard Report. </srcDesc><srcMedName><MedNameCd value="015" /></srcMedName><srcCitatn><resTitle>BLM Instruction Memorandum No. 2011-063, Change 1</resTitle><resAltTitle>Revised Bureau of Land Management (BLM) Administrative Units (Boundaries) Data Standards and Database Submission Requirements</resAltTitle><date><pubDate>2011-11-16T00:00:00</pubDate></date><resEd>Change 1</resEd><resEdDate>20111116</resEdDate><presForm><fgdcGeoform>document</fgdcGeoform><PresFormCd value="001" /></presForm><citRespParty><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior, Bureau of Land Management (BLM)</rpOrgName><role><RoleCd value="006" /></role><rpCntInfo><cntAddress addressType="both"><city>Washington</city><adminArea>District of Columbia</adminArea><postCode>20240</postCode><country>UNITED STATES</country></cntAddress><cntOnlineRes><linkage>http://www.blm.gov</linkage><orFunct><OnFunctCd value="002" /></orFunct></cntOnlineRes></rpCntInfo></citRespParty></srcCitatn></dataSource><prcStep><stepDesc>Existing data was compared to the 2009 NAIP imagery and moved to make the data correct. The points were placed on the roof of the building and close to the entrance. Where multiple points exist, this identifes the co-location of offices. Efforts were made to review the upgraded ArcGIS metadata; however the metadata user needs to carefully and completely read the entire metadata document and when appropriate notify the BLM distributor of any metadata inconsistencies.
